message_1: What is the chemical equation of the decomposition reaction of Copper(II) carbonate?
message_2:
The decomposition reaction of Copper(II) carbonate (CuCO₃) involves heating the compound, which leads to the formation of Copper(II) oxide (CuO) and Carbon dioxide (CO₂) gas. The balanced chemical equation for this decomposition reaction is:

CuCO₃ (s) → CuO (s) + CO₂ (g)
